newsitem.title: INDONESIA: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - Oct 29.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - Oct 29.

text.p: The following are the leading stories in the Indonesian press on October 29. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy. Telephone: (6221) 384-6364. Fax: (6221) 344-8404.
Germany hopes that Indonesia will remain politically stable and continue to concentrate on economic development.
Between 12,000 and 31,000 people die every year from the Aquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome (AIDS), a research group from the University of Indonesia said.
Shares in state-owned Bank Negara Indonesia (BNI) will be priced at 850 rupiah for the initial public offering period. Lead underwriters PT Danareksa Sekuritas said this was a ten percent discount.
Transaction fees on the Jakarta stock exchange were expected to be the lowest in the Southeast Asian region by the year 1998, the exchange president commissioner Fuad Bawazier said.
